instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
This board came from another service, they repaired it and changed the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but it turns off after power on.

I changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> to discard but now it stays at 20V and 267 ma.

<SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> is 0V.

I have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.2v

<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PWM2</SIGNAL> 2.49V
<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PWM1</SIGNAL> 2.49V

I am missing <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Do you get L7370 voltage?
Tried known good BIOS?

Work with the board alone on the desk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
L7370 : 1V

I haven't tried bios yet.

The equipment arrived on, only it turned off and showed Chinese letters

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: If board stopped to turn on after you've changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, recheck your job; possibly knocked off components, bad solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
ok, I saw that it had a consumption of 200ma fixed. Then I put the thermal camera and it heats me <RESISTOR>R7733</RESISTOR>.

I remove <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and now the machine changes to 19V and consumption of 6ma.

I already have the voltage of <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWORK</SIGNAL> 2.95V

<SIGNAL>PPVCCOPC_S0G</SIGNAL> beeps me to ground, but on ohm scale it's 060.1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Low resistance to ground on CPU coils is normal.

Did you apply power without <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>???
The board may be trash now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: that's right, remove <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and the motherboard takes 19v and consumes as if it turned on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Big error; don't do that ever again!

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7730</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.
Be sure all traces and surrounding components are good; pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>/33 and R/<CAPACITOR>C7730</CAPACITOR>.

Then pray half hour and test the board again with power...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
the problem was <TRANSISTOR>Q7730</TRANSISTOR>.

Now the board when connecting the battery flex does not finish turning on, it restarts the system.

When disconnecting the flex it turns on without problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Try known good battery; not "new chinese".

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I already placed the motherboard in another case with a good battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Is the battery charging in off state?
If starts in SMC bypass, still turns off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Does it make any difference that the machine when turned on without the battery flex, does not show an X in the battery icon when showing the login?

I have put another plate and I have done the same to remove the flex from the battery and it shows an X where the battery icon is.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88624, member: 682"]
Big error; don't do that ever again!

Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7730</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.
Be sure all traces and surrounding components are good; pay atention to <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>/33 and R/<CAPACITOR>C7730</CAPACITOR>.

Then pray half hour and test the board again with power...
[/QUOTE]

Before finding the fault here, I had changed the Bios for another of the same model only from a different manufacturer.

Could this have affected something?

Should I reprogram new Bios with your serial number?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88655, member: 682"]
Is the battery charging in off state?

no it is not loading

If starts in SMC bypass, still turns off?
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Put back original BIOS; or use known good dump.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
put the bios originally.

Voltages on i2c is 3.38v

Diode mode is 444 on both

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Other MLB recognizes and charges this battery?
Inspect both ends of battery data cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88678, member: 682"]
Other MLB recognizes and charges this battery?
R: I have put a board from another model but <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in the top case that has the bad board and everything works perfectly, it charges well.

Inspect both ends of battery data cable.
R: I already changed the flex of the battery identification.
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Then try known good SMC.
